summary: When a deranged high-school teacher kills the family of the girl, Donna, that he loves, in a disturbed attempt to force her into a relationship with him, the man is caught and sent to prison. However years later, at her high school prom, Donna is about to come face to face with the murderer once more. Will Donna and her friends escape the psychopath?

Very much a forgotten contributor to the Slasher era of the 90's / 00's, but Prom Night offers all the usual fun and cliched entertainment that this genre of movie always does. After Donna witnessed the murder of all her family upon returning home one night, she has been plagued with depression and hallucinations that her former teacher, and killer of her relations, would someday return to finish her off too. Of course, after much build up, he finally does make a reappearance after escaping the jail he was held in, typically on the night of her senior prom. As her friends keep finding a reason to wander off on their own, you just know they will all be picked off one by one, and the police officers are about as helpful as a chocolate fire guard in ensuring all the cast dies until that moment when the lead star is about to get butchered. To be fair, it does play on the suspense element and there are some jumpy moments, but seeing the killer from the offset somehow takes away the element of surprise and mystery that you often enjoy from regular whodunnit masked killer movies. I'm not familiar with any of the cast members which is unsurprisingly why this perhaps wasn't advertised as much as other horrors, but they do do a good job in ensuring a solid 90 minutes of entertainment. I had seen this before, but admittedly forgotten much about it as there's no particularly original or gruesome scenes that make it memorable. I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy it as it's very easy watching material and very much taps into one of my many cheesy weaknesses. It definitely shows my immature side as I'd say this is mainly appealing for a teenage target market, albeit perhaps not the perfect viewing for the night before their prom :)

Vapid, vacuous, an utter waste of time and money.  What the hell were the filmmakers going for exactly?  You have existing source material as well as decades of slasher horror history to springboard from....  and THIS is what you come up with, a killer in a baseball cap?  It's not a whodunit which throws out the appeal of a mystery, and it's also PG-13 which throws out any chance of seeing some genre goods like bloody kills and gore.

On top of that, the movie's script is so lazy and undercooked.  Nothing is developed so you don't really have a clue as to why or how....  and frankly you're not gonna care anyways.  Could this movie be any more dull, I even chuckled when I saw words like "production designer" lol, there was zero evidence of anything resembling design in this movie.  

Bottom line, Prom Night fails as a horror film, as a slasher film, and as a film period.  How do you manage to remake a not so great slasher film from the 80's and do it worse??  Clearly advanced technology and a bigger budget can't buy talent...  Not even the smidgen it would have taken to make a simple entertaining stalk n slash.

We've seen it all before way too many times, and even under better execution. Brittany Snow is decent here, even though she doesn't have much to do but scream and run away from the killer. The original "Prom Night" is not a masterpiece, but this sure makes it look like a classic. You want a good, fun remake of a slasher movie, check out "My Bloody Valentine." This "Prom Night" is one you want to and easily can forget.
